snippet: A rich trove of archives and resources at the New York Public Library cross-references names and addresses with the long-awaited 1940 data, and the results are eye-opening.
abstract: Francis X Clines The City Life column praises rich trove of archives and resources at the New York Public Library's Milstein Division, which has cross-referenced names and addresses with long-awaited 1940 census data; holds result is eye-opening for scholars and family genealogists both.
lead_paragraph: A rich trove of archives and resources at the New York Public Library cross-references names and addresses with the long-awaited 1940 data, and the results are eye-opening.

headline.seo: The New York Public Library Cracks the 1940 Census
